description: From Middle English daunten, from Old French danter, from Latin domitō (“tame”, verb), frequentative of Latin domō (“tame, conquer”, verb), from Proto-Italic *domaō, from Proto-Indo-European *demh₂- (“to domesticate, tame”). Doublet of dompt.

verbs.description: daunt (third-person singular simple present daunts, present participle daunting, simple past and past participle daunted)
